alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 9:27AM EDT until July 01 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Gibson County in southwestern Indiana... Pike County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 915 AM CDT/1015 AM EDT/. * At 826 AM CDT/926 AM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Petersburg to near Winslow to 6 miles west of Lynnville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oakland City, Petersburg, Lynnville, Winslow, Folsomville, Elberfeld, Somerville, Spurgeon and Mackey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 41 and 52. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 31 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
